results.description:
It's time to sprint, folks! The Hack4Sac event (in honor of National Day of Civic Hacking!) is less than one month away. We have specific projects in mind for this upcoming Hack Night:

Activities for May 14, 2013:

1) Code for Sacramento logo design challenge!
2) Help configure the look and feel of Sacramento's open data resource site
3) Contribute to our growing open data collection!!!

Seriously, our civic data assets and collections of community info leads are growing by the day, thanks to the amazing people who've shared their ideas with us!

Whether you are a data enthusiast, an auspicious coder, or otherwise uber resourceful citizen researcher... we will have a task for you at Civic Hack Night. Reach out to hello@codeforsacramento.org, or just show up and join us on Tuesday, May 14th @ 7:00 pm, for some serious civic game changing!!!
results.name: CIVIC HACK NIGHT - Code for Sacramento

venue.name: Drexel University Center for Graduate Studies

results.description:
This is a SARTA event sponsored by Drexel University and should be very interesting and useful to all of us studying and/or implementing the Lean Startup methodologies.

Details and Registration: http://www.sarta.org/LeanStartup.html

Course Description:

Startups can seem mysterious. One skyrockets and another fails randomly but business doesn’t have to feel like voodoo; and success isn’t random. There’s a better way, a new science that’s researching why startups fail and how to make them succeed. The data shows that thousands of smart entrepreneurs have been doing it wrong. A startup is not a ‘business’, it is a ‘search for a business’. Most businesses, from Twitter to Groupon, didn’t start with the right idea. They figured it out on the way. What differentiates a successfully launched enterprise is one who can unearth the best ideas under duress - those who can find ‘“the pivot” - the point of reinvention when they realize that their original ideas need retooling. And, more critically, that they can find their market before they run out of money.

Tristan will walk you through the lean startup methodology; a simple set of steps and specific checklists that guide entrepreneurs step-by-step through testing key assumptions, discovering the ‘killer’ problems, adapting around them, iterating to a proven solution and then successfully executing their business idea.

Presenter

Tristan Kromer
Lean Startup Coach, LUXr; Coordinator & Mentor, Lean Startup Circle
results.name: Radical New Ways to Build Your Business Faster and Launch Your Idea Stronger

results.description:
We're excited to host this Google I/O extended! We'll be streaming sessions live from Google I/O.

The agenda will be somewhat (un)conference ish, based on your interest in items in this sample agenda: https://developers.google.com/shared/io/googleio2013-agenda-example.pdf

In the early morning we will do an icebreaker so people can meet one another, we'll decide if we want to do demos, tech talks, discussions, etc... Throughout the day we will be streaming the conference. People will be co-working... It will be very informal. Show up, meet people, work on your projects, and learn the newest stuff that Google is releasing alongside other devs.
results.name: Google I/O Extended

results.description: The official group page is here. You have to join to rsvp but for now everyone who is interested in Drupal development is welcome.
results.name: Sacramento Drupal Users Group

results.description:
The Arduino meetup group meets at Hacker Lab on the first and third Thursdays of every month.

The idea is that you show up after 5 PM with the equipment you need to work:

- your laptop

- a USB cable

- Bring an Arduino card. They are available at Radio Shack for a reasonable price.

Work on a project or help someone with their project. We are here to learn together, and to work together on huge projects.

For each meeting, a subject will be announced at least a week before the meeting. At the meeting we will announce a challenge based on that subject. If you are interested, you can participate in trying to accomplish the challenge with everyone working together.

Thank you, and happy hacking!
results.how_to_find_us: Go through to the back area
results.name: Arduino Hackers

results.description:
Formally Sac Node.js, this is the first major JavaScript for Sacramento. This event begin with lightning talks, then continue to an interactive tutorial (TBD), and some time for everyone to play with what they've learned. Bring your laptops!

If anyone would like to give a lightning talk, please contact me as soon as possible with what you would like to talk about. They can be about anything in JavaScript (Server or client-side), and must be between 5 and 10 minutes.
results.name: SacJS

results.description:
Come learn the foundations of welding from the ground up with Dave Malby of Hacker Lab. This will be a two hour class that will go over safety and basic usage of oxy-acetylene welding. It's time you learned the skills to create anything you want with steel and this amazing torch!
The course fee will be $60. We are limiting the class size to 5 students so everyone will have one-on-one time with the instructor. Everyone will get the opportunity to weld! RSVP here and we will contact you with more details within the next couple weeks.

Class price is $40. Must RSVP here: http://www.eventbrite.com/event/6682283891

This is a required course to use the welding equipment at Hacker Lab. Open to the public. You do not need to be a Hacker Lab member to attend.
results.name: Intro to Oxy Acetylene Welding

results.description:
Come in and plug in for FREE Coworking at Hacker Lab.
Meet and greet! Then get to work!
We have free pour over coffee and tea.
Free coworking is bi-weekly and is followed by Hacker Lab lunchtime.
See you there!

Just come on in and plug in.
We have a large open coworking area, so have a seat!
results.name: FREE CoWorking Wednesdays @Hacker Lab

results.description:
Come out and have a coffee or lunch with people from the Hacker Lab community.

To me the best networking is done when real friendships are created.
Having lunch with someone is a great way to make friends and get to know people.

These lunches are smaller only about 4 to 6 people but they are great for conversation time with like minded people.

Come out! Come out!
Gina
510.394.4462

****UPDATE*****

We have moved to Hamburger Patties..

See you there!!
results.name: Hacker Lab Lunchtime

results.description:
Who should attend?

If you’re a startup interested in making products that people care about, you won’t want to miss this class / workshop.

If you’re a designer interested in learning about this user centered design technique, you will also want to attend.

Persona based methodology helps create tight products that speak to your users, helps teams get on the same page, and creates the foundation of a user centered design process.
results.name: Persona Based Design for Startups

meta.title: Meetup Events v2
meta.description: Access Meetup events using a group, member, or event id. Events in private groups are available only to authenticated members of those groups. To search events by topic or location, see [Open Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/open_events).
